data: OB Magnesium Sulfate Administration for Fetal Neuroprotection (Module)
This PowerPlan applies to gestational age (EGA) less than or equal to 33 + 6 Weeks
Refer to Society of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists of Canada (SOGC) Clinical Practice Guideline Magnesium Sulfate for Fetal Neuroprotection
q5min during magnesium sulfate loading dose
q1h during magnesium sulfate maintenance infusion
Continuous on mother during magnesium sulfate loading dose, then q1h
q4h for patient on magnesium sulfate infusion; notify provider if level of consciousness decreases
q4h, assess biceps or patellar reflexes, muscle tone and strength during magnesium sulfate maintenance infusion
q4h during magnesium sulfate maintenance dose infusion
For Fetal Neuroprotection consider total infusion rate of 125 mL/h or 80 mL/h
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 55 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Discontinue tocolytic drugs for preterm labour. Example: NIFEdipine, indomethacin, nitroglycerin
Following delivery of preterm newborn, discontinue magnesium sulfate if solely for fetal neuroprotection
Consider consulting Nephrology, Internal Medicine or Pharmacy for patients with abnormal renal function
4 g, IV, once, administer over: 30 minute
magnesium sulfate continuous infusion (40 mg/mL) in NS standard
1 g, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
Consider ordering Labs for Neuroprotection purposes only if not already done
Obtain labs prior to starting magnesium sulfate infusion but do not delay start of infusion
Blood, Routine, Unit Collect: No, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Routine, Unit Collect: No, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Routine, Unit Collect: No, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Routine, Unit Collect: No, Collection: T;N, once
